location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from James Dow, Assistant Surgeon, Temporarily in Charge of the Residency, Bushire, to Richard Thomas Goodwin, Secretary and Translator in the Office of Country Correspondence, Bombay

mods.abstract: In this letter James Dow, Assistant Surgeon, temporarily in charge of the Residency, acknowledges the receipt of Richard Thomas Goodwin's letter, dated 1 February, which included two letters from the Governor of Bombay, Mountstuart Elphinstone, addressed to His Royal Highness Hussain Ali [Ḥusayn ‘Alī Mīrzā], Prince Regent of Fars, and to His Excellency Mohomed Hossain Khan, Prince Minister at Tehran, respectively. Dow states that the letters were forwarded immediately following their arrival at Bushire.
